pgTitle: List of Christian religious houses in Denmark

rows.text: Hospital of the Holy Ghost, Copenhagen
first half of 12th century-1176; moved to Æbelholt
1420–1537; now the site of Marienlyst Castle
Benedictine nuns to 1187, Cistercian nuns thereafter
1162/63-c.1169/70; after Carthusians left, site abandoned, and later given as a grange to the Cistercians at Sorø
Hospital of the Holy Ghost, Elvedgård
Hospital of the Holy Ghost, Nakskov
Order of the Holy Ghost, monks and nuns
Benedictine nuns to 1177, thereafter Cistercian nuns
Benedictine monks to 1161 or 1162, thereafter Cistercians
Hospital of the Holy Ghost, Aalborg

1125-1431 and 1441–1445; the premises were given to the Carthusians in 1432; the Benedictines reoccupied them in 1441, but were removed again in 1445, when the site was given as an estate to the Bridgettines of Mariager Abbey
1432–1441; established in the former Benedictine Glenstrup Abbey
Premonstratensian canons from Børglum Abbey to 1200; Premonstratensian nuns thereafter
1167–1172); community moved here from Veng Abbey, and moved on to found Øm Abbey
1172-1536; the community settled at Øm in 1172, having been formerly located, in quick succession from 1165 onwards, at Sabro, Sminge, Veng and Kalvø
Benedictine double monastery until c. 1140; Benedictine nuns thereafter
c.1125-1428; monks moved to Essenbæk c.1140
Hospital of the Holy Ghost, Randers
1165; community moved almost immediately to Sminge
1165–1166; community moved here from Sabro, and moved on to Veng
Benedictine monks to 1165; Cistercian monks thereafter
1060s-1165; after the Benedictines left, the premises were occupied briefly by Cistercian monks from Sminge, who almost immediately moved on to Kalvø
Hospital of the Holy Ghost, Fåborg
c.1075-c.1100; replaced by St. Canute's Abbey, Odense
c.1100-1536; replaced St. Alban's Priory, Odense
founded 1716; amalgamated with the Roskilde Adelige Jomfrukoster in 1974
1170-1532; the community moved here from the former double monastery at Seem
Benedictine double monastery to 1170, when nuns removed; Cistercian monks from 1171
order uncertain but closely connected to the Franciscan friary
